item.title: about me
item.description: current assistant professor of statistics Econometric Institute, Erasmus School of Economics, Erasmus University Rotterdam past research fellow of statistics Department of Law and Economics, UnitelmaSapienza University of Rome education phd in methodological statistics at La Sapienza University of Rome (2020) msc in statistics and decision sciences at La Sapienza University of Rome (2016) bsc in statistics at La Sapienza University of Rome (2013) grants research grant for junior researcher “Avvio alla ricerca” (2017) award in Stats under the Stars (an Italian Statistical Society competition): best report (2017) academic services programme committee member of “SIS 2022: the 51st Scientific Meeting of the Italian Statistical Society” (2022) programme committee member of the conference “IES 2022: Innovation and Society 5.

item.title: events
item.description: future conferences 51st Scientific Meeting of the Italian Statistical Society (June, 22-24, 2022) ECDA 2022: European Conference on Data Analysis (June 14-16, 2022) 24th Internation Conference on Computational Statistics (August 23-26, 2022) DSSV 2022: Data Science Statistics and Visualisation (June 27-29, 2022) IES 2022: Innovation and Society 5.0: Statistical and Economic Models and Techniques for Quality Assessment (January 27-28, 2022) recent events CLADAG 2021: 13th Scientific Meeting Classification and Data Analysis Group (September 9-11, 2021) 63rd ISI World Statistics Congress 2021 (July 11-16, 2021) DSSV-ECDA 2021: Data Science Statistics and Visualisation and European Conference on Data Analysis (July 07-09, 2021) 50th Scientific Meeting of the Italian Statistical Society (June 21-25, 2021) Workshop on Models and Learning for Clustering and Classification (September 2020) Data Science, Statistics & Visualization 2020 (July 29-31, 2020)

item.title: materials and info
item.description: I am a statistician and my research is focused on the methodological and computational aspects of data analysis. The best feeling is when I can use my knowledge to solve practical and real problems. I am currently working on latent variable models, unsupervised classification and model-based composite indicators. ongoing projects seminars and talks events teaching material

item.title: ongoing projects
item.description: my current researches are: Cavicchia, C., Vichi, M. and Zaccaria, G. Gaussian mixture model with an extended ultrametric covariance structure the maximum likelihood estimation of a Gaussian Mixture Model where the covariance structure is modeled according to an extended ultrametric covariance matrix, the model extends the concepts and definitions of ultrametric matrix in order to model generic covariance structure. (Revision requested) Cavicchia, C., Vichi, M. and Zaccaria, G.

item.title: publications
item.description: refereed journal articles Cavicchia, C. and Sarnacchiaro, P. The effect of a new e-tivity on students’ performance and satisfaction in an online course Italian Journal of Applied Statistics, (2021) Cavicchia, C. and Vichi, M. Second-order Disjoint Factor Analysis Psychometrika, (2021) Cavicchia, C. and Sarnacchiaro, P. A multi-group higher-order factor analysis for studying the gender-effect in Teacher Job Satisfaction METRON, (2021) Cavicchia, C., Sarnacchiaro, P.

item.title: seminars and talks
item.description: seminars and invited talks Cost and performance: a composite indicator for separated waste collection in Italy - ISI 2021 International Statistical Institute World Statistics Congress “Statistics and Data Science for a Better World” (2021 - The Hague, Netherlands - Virtual) Hierarchical Disjoint Nonnegative Factor Analysis - EconJobMarket Erasmus University Rotterdam (2019 - Rotterdam, Netherlands) A composite indicator via hierarchical disjoint factor analysis for measuring the Italian football teams’ performances - ASA 2019 Scientific Conference on Statistics for Healt and Well-Being (2019 - Brescia, Italy)

item.title: teaching material
item.description: supervisions I am currently supervising three msc theses on Econometrics at Erasmus School of Economics I am currently supervising three msc theses on Data Science for Marketing Analytics at Erasmus School of Economics I am currently supervising two master theses within the II level master Quantitative methods and models for decision support at University of Rome UnitelmaSapienza the last two years I supervised fourteen bsc theses at Erasmus School of Economics on Adachi and Trendafilov (2018), Vichi and Kiers (2001) and Bluszcz (2016)
